name: Ontario
fact: Home to the nation’s capital (Ottawa) and the largest city (Toronto).

name: Quebec
fact: Canada’s only majority-French province; Montréal is the largest city.

name: British Columbia
fact: Mildest climate among provinces; Vancouver is a major tech and film hub.

name: Alberta
fact: Strong energy sector and world-famous Banff & Jasper National Parks.

name: Manitoba
fact: Known for polar bears near Churchill and a vibrant arts scene in Winnipeg.

name: Saskatchewan
fact: A leading producer of potash and wheat with big skies and prairies.

name: Nova Scotia
fact: Seafood, lighthouses and a growing tech/education hub in Halifax.

name: New Brunswick
fact: Only officially bilingual province; famous for the Bay of Fundy tides.

name: Prince Edward Island
fact: Smallest province; birthplace of Canadian Confederation (1864).

name: Newfoundland and Labrador
fact: Dramatic coastlines, icebergs and a distinct cultural heritage.

name: Yukon
fact: Aurora borealis, Klondike Gold Rush heritage and vast wilderness.

name: Northwest Territories
officialLanguages: 11 official languages (English, French and Indigenous languages)
fact: Great Slave Lake, Nahanni National Park and world-class aurora viewing.

name: Nunavut
fact: Canada’s newest territory (1999), Arctic tundra and Inuit culture.
